howtoinvestfordummies.model

Class Stock

  • java.lang.Object
    • howtoinvestfordummies.model.Investment
      • howtoinvestfordummies.model.Stock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInvestment

    public class Stock
extends Investment

    Represents a type of Investment user can perform. A stock of a company is simply a part of ownership in that company which can be represented in shares. Any stock can be identified with its ticker symbol. The value of the stock on a particular day is the money the investor would receive if he/she sold the stock on that day.

    Changes:
    • Added methods to set and read commission fees and percentage weights at investment level.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Represents toString version of the Stock object. It includes tickerSymbol, investment cost, investment value at the stock level.

      • getValue

        public double getValue(java.util.Date date)
        Finds current value of the stock. If the value is present locally, it takes value from the local file first and if it is not present, it returns the current value of the investment through web api call.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface IInvestment
        Specified by:
        getValue in class Investment
        Parameters:
        date - for which investment value needs to be found.
        Returns:
        value of the investment in double.
